abstract: Carriers in the United States, China and the Middle East oppose a plan to charge carriers for their emissions when they land or take off in the European Union. Russia and India have hinted at retaliation if the plan takes effect.
snippet: Carriers in the United States, China and the Middle East oppose a plan to charge carriers for their emissions when they land or take off in the European Union. Russia and India have hinted at retaliation if the plan takes effect.
lead_paragraph: The European Union's advocate general has affirmed the bloc's authority to require all airlines to pay for their greenhouse gas emissions when they land at or take off from European airports, James Kanter reports.
